meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for sale or trade.
meanings.sent1: Her merchantabilities were evident as she negotiated a great deal at the market.
meanings.sent2: His merchantabilities shone through when he managed to sell all his products in just one day.
meanings.sent3: The cat's merchantabilities were on display as it cleverly traded a toy for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The student's merchantabilities were like a shining beacon in the sea of commerce.
meanings.sent5: The merchantabilities of the old watch made it a valuable antique.

meanings.definition: The skills or qualities that make someone successful in business.
meanings.sent1: She honed her merchantabilities through years of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: His natural merchantabilities allowed him to thrive in the competitive business world.
meanings.sent3: The clown's merchantabilities in juggling were surprisingly useful in his new business venture.
meanings.sent4: Her merchantabilities were like a secret weapon, propelling her to the top of the corporate ladder.
meanings.sent5: The mentor passed on his valuable merchantabilities to the eager apprentice.
